intro: Lessingianthus glabratus, commonly known as the smoothless sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of smaller florets. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Lessingianthus glabratus is known for its drought tolerance and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant appearance.
